intro: Sedum penthorum, commonly known as the showy sedum, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats, often in open areas with full sun. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions due to its water-storing leaves. Sedum penthorum is a perennial species that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds.
